poem:
Jealous Heat

A simple flame  
betrays,   
loveless rage boiled—  
clear as water  
yet blind,  
devouring sight  
where green dreams grow.  

Oh, to enclose  
light within lids  
and see—  
the tender ache  
of vision's  
quiet withdrawal,  
a world washed  
by shadows.  

Beneath,  
a burning silence,  
life yet untouched.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Man jailed for 15 years after blinding acquaintance with sodium hydroxide A man who blinded an acquaintance with a corrosive liquid at an eco-village has been jailed for 15 years. Jivan Dean, 24, attacked Raven Riley, 21, with sodium hydroxide – an alkaline also known as caustic soda – in a jealous rage after wrongly believing he had contacted his girlfriend. Dean was seen heating a liquid in a pan on a hob before hurling". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Man jailed for 15 years after blinding acquaintance with sodium hydroxide A man who blinded an acquaintance with a corrosive liquid at an eco-village has been jailed for 15 years. Jivan Dean, 24, attacked Raven Riley, 21, with sodium hydroxide – an alkaline also known as caustic soda – in a jealous rage after wrongly believing he had contacted his girlfriend. Dean was seen heating a liquid in a pan on a hob before hurling
